dcterms:creator: M. Aartsen
M. Ackermann
J. Adams
J. Aguilar
M. Ahlers
M. Ahrens
dcterms:description: The IceCube simulation used for training and testing the dynedge classifications and reconstructions is borrowed from the collaborationâ€™s simulation for neutrino oscillation analyses. The dataset and selection process is similar to the ones described in the reference, which is also used in another reference. The interactions were simulated with GENIE, and simulations of the propagation of secondaries, particle showers, and the propagation of Cherenkov light are the same as used in the reference. The event selection aims to provide a clean neutrino sample in the DeepCore region of IceCube by removing pure noise events, atmospheric muon events and by applying containment cuts.
dcterms:title: IceCube simulation for neutrino oscillation analyses

dcterms:creator: C. Andreopoulos
A. Bell
D. Bhattacharya
F. Cavanna
J. Dobson
S. Dytman
dcterms:description: GENIE is a neutrino Monte Carlo generator used for simulating neutrino interactions. The dataset includes simulated interactions that are utilized in the analysis of neutrino events.
dcterms:title: GENIE simulated interactions

dcterms:creator: R. Abbasi
dcterms:description: The retro algorithm dataset is used for low energy event reconstruction in IceCube DeepCore. It serves as a benchmark for comparing the performance of the proposed GNN-based reconstruction method.
dcterms:title: retro algorithm dataset
